pr_title: Split Testerina assertions test case into multiple tests

timeline.message: Split Testerina assertions test case into multiple tests

timeline.bodyText: @Ibaqu We need to add logic(appending test and asserting it) to test that the functions get executed in correct order. WDYT?
timeline.author: Dilhasha

replies.bodyText:
There is a similar logic included in the beforeAfter and beforeEachAfterEach test cases. It is also there in the dependsOn test case as well. In those tests, a string is passed between the functions and the end result is asserted to see if the order is executed correctly. https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang/pull/25622/files#diff-43b6d1a6469d4251593b5734978c5e38
@Dilhasha Is this what you are referring to? If so, should I include such logic in the 'pathVerification' test case as well?
replies.author: Ibaqu

replies.bodyText:
Yes that's correct.
Let's include similar logic in test cases wherever applicable rather than using println.
